cab.content: Military Secret,975190From. Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of State for India,3rd July 1919.(Repeated Constantinople.)(Received 11 a.m., 5th.)8903. Mallesoii's agent writes Samarkand, lGth June, that agitators who include Indians and Turks, and also some Austrians and Germans, are still busy urging necessity of saving Islam from suppression by Entente Powers and proclaiming that time has come for all true believers with Bolshevik help to rise and defend their faith and prevent the Holy Places from falling into the hands of the infidel. Sheikh Ul Islam at Samarkand does not sympathise with agitators. Afghan agitators at Bokhara are moving to Tashkent as they are receiving no support from Amir of Bokhara. Agent makes no mention of Enver's presence or expected arrival in Turkestan and this is the same with other reports reaching Malleson.
